headline: Podcast: U.S. Stocks Flat as Investors Await Fed Chair’s Speech
summary: Investors are looking ahead to earnings from major retailers and a speech from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell at the Jackson Hole symposium in Wyoming later this week. Plus: Solar stocks First Solar and Sunrun add to Friday’s gains.

content.title: Podcast: U.S. Stocks Flat as Investors Await Fed Chair’s Speech
content.summary: Investors are looking ahead to earnings from major retailers and a speech from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell at the Jackson Hole symposium in Wyoming later this week. Plus: Solar stocks First Solar and Sunrun add to Friday’s gains.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Talking Points
summary: Major U.S. stock indexes moved little on Monday, with the Dow and S&P 500 closing the day with slight declines and the Nasdaq edging higher.  President Trump met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday afternoon, and the tone was better than their previous, contentious meeting in February.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Talking Points
content.summary: Major U.S. stock indexes moved little on Monday, with the Dow and S&P 500 closing the day with slight declines and the Nasdaq edging higher.  President Trump met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday afternoon, and the tone was better than their previous, contentious meeting in February.

headline: Why Is First Solar (FSLR) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) jumped 10.4% in the afternoon session after the U.S. Treasury Department and IRS released new guidance on clean energy tax credits that was more favorable than investors had feared, continuing a rally from the previous session.

content.title: Why Is First Solar (FSLR) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
content.summary: Shares of solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) jumped 10.4% in the afternoon session after the U.S. Treasury Department and IRS released new guidance on clean energy tax credits that was more favorable than investors had feared, continuing a rally from the previous session.

headline: Stocks to Watch Monday: Novo Nordisk,  TeraWulf, UnitedHealth, Soho House
summary: ↗️ Novo Nordisk (NVO): The Food and Drug Administration approved Novo Nordisk’s popular weight-loss drug Wegovy to treat a form of liver disease. Shares closed up 3.8% on Monday. (Read more about weight-loss drugs’ surprise foe).

headline: These Stocks Moved Moving the Most Today: Dayforce, Novo Nordisk, GoodRx, UnitedHealth, Sunrun, Duolingo, TeraWulf, and More
summary: Stocks were flat on Monday, but things will heat up later this week with a number of key retailers, including Walmart, are scheduled to issue quarterly earnings reports.  There will also be Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s speech Friday at the policy symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo.  Dayforce  jumped 26% after Bloomberg reported that private-equity firm Thoma Bravo was in talks to acquire the HR management software company.

content.title: These Stocks Moved Moving the Most Today: Dayforce, Novo Nordisk, GoodRx, UnitedHealth, Sunrun, Duolingo, TeraWulf, and More
content.summary: Stocks were flat on Monday, but things will heat up later this week with a number of key retailers, including Walmart, are scheduled to issue quarterly earnings reports.  There will also be Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s speech Friday at the policy symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo.  Dayforce  jumped 26% after Bloomberg reported that private-equity firm Thoma Bravo was in talks to acquire the HR management software company.

headline: The Stock Market Thought Solar Was Dead Under Trump But This Is Why Stocks Are Roaring Back
summary: The stock market believed that President Donald Trump's "Big Beautiful" budget was a death knell for solar, with its cuts to clean energy and doubling down on fossil fuels.  On Monday, Sunrun and NextTracker roared higher after upgrades, to outperform and buy, respectively.  Sunrun added 11.4%, NextTracker climbed 11.8%, during Monday's stock market.

content.title: The Stock Market Thought Solar Was Dead Under Trump But This Is Why Stocks Are Roaring Back
content.summary: The stock market believed that President Donald Trump's "Big Beautiful" budget was a death knell for solar, with its cuts to clean energy and doubling down on fossil fuels.  On Monday, Sunrun and NextTracker roared higher after upgrades, to outperform and buy, respectively.  Sunrun added 11.4%, NextTracker climbed 11.8%, during Monday's stock market.

headline: Sunrun and Other Clean-Energy Stocks Rise, Extending Relief Rally
summary: Danish wind-turbine maker Vestas was also among the gainers, climbing 15% on Monday.  Friday's Treasury guidance helped spell out when projects will count as “under construction,” which determines which wind and solar farms can claim tax credits.  The Trump administration is phasing out tax credits early, and after a tough year for the sector, some feared the rules could be changed retroactively.

content.title: Sunrun and Other Clean-Energy Stocks Rise, Extending Relief Rally
content.summary: Danish wind-turbine maker Vestas was also among the gainers, climbing 15% on Monday.  Friday's Treasury guidance helped spell out when projects will count as “under construction,” which determines which wind and solar farms can claim tax credits.  The Trump administration is phasing out tax credits early, and after a tough year for the sector, some feared the rules could be changed retroactively.

headline: Clean energy investors relieved by Trump tax rule changes
summary: Late on Friday, the Treasury Department narrowed the definition for what it means for a solar or wind project to be considered under construction, a requirement to qualify for federal tax credits worth 30% of a project's cost.  The changes include requiring developers of big solar arrays and wind farms to complete physical work rather than simply show that they have invested capital.

content.title: Clean energy investors relieved by Trump tax rule changes
content.summary: Late on Friday, the Treasury Department narrowed the definition for what it means for a solar or wind project to be considered under construction, a requirement to qualify for federal tax credits worth 30% of a project's cost.  The changes include requiring developers of big solar arrays and wind farms to complete physical work rather than simply show that they have invested capital.

headline: Why Solar Stocks Are Surging Today
summary: Solar stocks jumped Monday, after the Treasury Department released guidance on projects that could qualify for clean energy tax credits that was less restrictive than investors feared.

content.title: Why Solar Stocks Are Surging Today
content.summary: Solar stocks jumped Monday, after the Treasury Department released guidance on projects that could qualify for clean energy tax credits that was less restrictive than investors feared.

thumbnail.caption: K.C. Alfred / The San Diego Union-Tribune / Getty Images Citi and Jefferies analysts said the Treasury Department's latest guidance on federal tax incentives for clean energy projects was better than anticipated.

headline: Renewable-Power Stocks Are Taking Off. Their Prospects Are Mixed.
summary: Shares are rising across the sector because changes to eligibility for tax credits weren’t as draconian as feared.

content.title: Renewable-Power Stocks Are Taking Off. Their Prospects Are Mixed.
content.summary: Shares are rising across the sector because changes to eligibility for tax credits weren’t as draconian as feared.

headline: Top Stock Movers Now: Dayforce, Novo Nordisk, First Solar, and More
summary: Major U.S. equities indexes were little changed Monday morning, ahead of retail sector earnings reports and comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell due later in the week.

content.title: Top Stock Movers Now: Dayforce, Novo Nordisk, First Solar, and More
content.summary: Major U.S. equities indexes were little changed Monday morning, ahead of retail sector earnings reports and comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell due later in the week.

thumbnail.caption: Dhiraj Singh / Bloomberg / Getty Images Novo Nordisk shares climbed after the Food and Drug Administration approved the drugmaker’s popular Wegovy weight-loss medicine to treat a serious liver disease.

headline: Solar stocks, Tesla, TeraWulf & Google: Trending Tickers
summary: Sunrun (RUN) stock was upgraded to Outperform from Sector Perform by RBC Capital Markets as the US Treasury Department and Internal Revenue Service (IRS) released favorable guidance on clean energy tax credit qualifications. Other clean energy names like First Solar (FSLR) and Enphase (ENPH) are also getting a boost. Tesla (TSLA) is reportedly offering leasing companies discounts of up to 40% to clear inventory in the UK, according to The Times.  Bitcoin miner TeraWulf (WULF) is gaining attention after Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) Google increased its stake in the company to 14%. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Other clean energy names like First Solar (FSLR) and Enphase (ENPH) are also getting a boost.

Tesla (TSLA) is reportedly offering leasing companies discounts of up to 40% to clear inventory in the UK, according to The Times.

Bitcoin miner TeraWulf (WULF) is gaining attention after Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) Google increased its stake in the company to 14%.

headline: Discovering 3 Stocks That May Be Priced Below Their Estimated Worth
summary: As the Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches an all-time high, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq experience slight declines, investors are keeping a close eye on potential interest rate cuts from the Federal Reserve. Amidst this mixed performance in major indices, identifying stocks that may be priced below their estimated worth could offer intriguing opportunities for those looking to navigate current market conditions. In such an environment, a good stock is often one with strong fundamentals and...
